H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3843.def: = block made of clay in a mold and either dried in the sun or hardened in an oven; ► used as a building material, especially in places where stone or wood was scarce

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H4692.def: = state of severe sorrow or anguish

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H1785.def: = fence of poles or stakes, sometimes reinforced with, or even made of earth and stones; ► used to fortify entrenchments

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H5550.def: = earthen mound, cast up against the wall of a city ► in order to enable to enemy to scale the wall

H4264.def: = open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3733.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a young male sheep

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H4227.def: = a thick plate made of pottery (and later of metal), with small depressions similar to a modern waffle iron; ► it was placed on three stones between which a fire was built; bread dough was then put on its surface and cooked

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H8042.def: = the direction facing left or northward from the perspective of the location in focus; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H6654.def: = side of a person's body, especially right above the hip; ► place where people sometimes carried their small children; ≈ location where one's body is unprotected and vulnerable

H5742.def: = type of vegetable from a low-branched plant with a weak stem; its flowers develop into a short pod with only one seed inside, about the size of a small pea, one type of which is reddish brown in color; ◄ Lens culinaris; ► typically used in soups and stews

H1764.def: = type of grain, reaching a height of about 90 cm.; ◄ |iPanicum miliaceum|i* or |iSorghum vulgare|i*; ► used for making bread or porridge; ≈ regarded as inferior to {L:wheat<SDBH:חִטָּה>}

H3698.def: meaning unsure, probably: = type of grain with loose ears and triangular grains which do not loosen from the chaff when ripening; grows in relatively infertile and dry soil; with a sweet, nutty flavor; ◄ Triticum dicoccum; ► used for making bread; ≈ regarded as inferior to {L:wheat<SDBH:חִטָּה>}
